wikipedia_page.main:
Mark Anthony Blake (born 16 December 1970) is an English former professional footballer who played in midfielder.
He notably played in the Premier League for both Aston Villa and Leicester City, as well as in the Football League for Wolverhampton Wanderers, Portsmouth, Walsall, Mansfield Town and Kidderminster Harriers.

response: *Mark Blake (politician) (died 1886), Member of Parliament for Mayo

link_mentions.page: 1994 Football League First Division play-off Final
response: Leicester City's opponents in their semi-final were Tranmere Rovers, with the first leg being hosted at Prenton Park, Tranmere, on 15 May 1994.  The match ended goalless with one of the best chances falling to the home side, when John Aldridge's close range shot was saved by the fingertips of Gavin Ward.  The return leg took place three days later at Filbert Street in Leicester.  In the last moments of the first half, Leicester took the lead: Mark Blake's shot hit the post and Ian Ormondroyd converted the rebound.  A minute into the second half, Pat Nevin levelled the score by converting a Ged Brannan cross.  David Speedie, a second-half substitute, then restored Leicester's lead with four minutes remaining, heading in a free kick from Blake.  With only seconds of the match remaining, an altercation between Speedie and the Tranmere goalkeeper Eric Nixon resulted in both players being sent off.  The match ended 2–1 to Leicester and they qualified for the final.
